p: Kumari et al. (2015) assessed the impact of various levels of CO 2, ambient (382 ppm) and augmented (570 ppm), and O 3, ambient (50 ppb) and augmented (70 ppb) on the potato physiological and biochemical responses ( Solanum tuberosum). They observed that augmented CO 2 cut down O 3 uptake, enhanced carbon assimilation, and curbed oxidative stress. Elevated CO 2 also mitigated the noxious effect of high O 3 on photosynthesis.
